definition: newcomer/fresh talent/newlywed, esp. new bride/bride and groom
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new generation of youths (generation X, Y etc)

sentences.english: High performing teams do an excellent job of "on-boarding" the new team member(s).
sentences.chinese: 高绩效团队在帮助新人融入方面也做得很出色。

sentences.english: Once, red is the main color of the couple in the new house.
sentences.chinese: 曾经，赤色是新人新房里的主颜色。

sentences.english: Air gun salute profusion, blooming new smile.
sentences.chinese: 礼炮缤纷空中啸，花团锦簇新人笑。

sentences.english: American honeymoon couples love their tropical beach honeymoons.
sentences.chinese: 美国新人比较喜欢热带海滩蜜月之旅。

sentences.english: The "New Human" refers to the young about 20 years old.
sentences.chinese: “新新人类”是指现今20岁左右的青年。

sentences.english: The next time I dunked was playing for the Sharks in my second game as a rookie.
sentences.chinese: 第二次灌篮，是在大鲨鱼队作为新人的第二场比赛。

sentences.english: Call new contacts to invite them to events, or to pass on information.
sentences.chinese: 通过联系新人来邀请他们参加活动，或者传递信息。

sentences.english: At the same time, the Chinese Ministry puts the inexperienced new recruit them.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，中文部却将没有经验的新人招进来。

sentences.english: Some new heads of research teams have come straight from earning a Ph.D.
sentences.chinese: 一些研究团队的头头直接来自博土新人。

sentences.english: What kind of spiritual clothes are you wearing – the old or the new?
sentences.chinese: 你身上还是穿着旧人，抑或已换上新人呢？

sentences.english: Country singer Taylor Swift is among the nominees for Best New Artist.
sentences.chinese: 乡村歌手泰勒斯维夫提名为最佳年度新人。

sentences.english: Just a rookie lawyer, Wright as he solves a variety of puzzling cases.
sentences.chinese: 身为新人律师，成步堂解决了众多谜题般的案件。

sentences.english: The new boss was determined to rid the company of all slackers.
sentences.chinese: 公司决定新人资老板可将公司所有偷懒者除名。

sentences.english: School is only fun from grades Pre-K through 2nd grade.
sentences.chinese: 在学校里最有趣的阶段就是从新人变成二年级生。

sentences.english: I'm just a small-time director, a new one at that.
sentences.chinese: 我只是个三流导演，一个新人。

sentences.english: The newcomer eliminated Mr Ivey thanks to a lucky draw on the last card dealt.
sentences.chinese: 这名新人依靠最后一张牌的好运气，打败了艾维先生。

definition: to play a leading role/to bear a heavy responsibility
troop arrangement/battle formation/lineup (of a sports team etc)
Cenozoic (geological era covering the last 65m years)
lit. old general/commander-in-chief 將帥|将帅, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess/fig. old-timer/veteran
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
